attributes.action: Keep religion off the UK high street.
attributes.additional_details: It often drowns out performers and other artists that have something to offer the good vibe of the city. It make people anxious and uncomfortable. it often starts arguments and heated debate, this is not the forum for this.
attributes.background: The high street is a place to shop, relax, and hang out with friends. Instead its a place where religious preechers shout, argue and make people uncomfortable. keep the preeching in the place of worship, not on the high street.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about prohibiting activities in specified places such as high streets are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
